1.heading: Kim.
1.title: "God Takes Kim from Me!"
1.author: Bill Griffith
1.appears_in: 5 p. in Tales of Sex and Death, no. 1 (Apr. 1971).
notes: A woman goes to a psychiatrist complaining that she's a jinx.

4.heading: Kim.
4.title: "I Can't Just Say Ethics Aren't My Department"
4.author: G
notes: Summary: Kim has taught Tiger Woods that he has to take a stand on Nike and manufacturing conditions abroad, and he calls her a warrior.

5.heading: Kim.
5.title: "I Could Get A Divorce"
5.author: G
notes: Summary: Wearing a Reebok hat, Tiger Woods dissociates himself from Nike, and regrets not meeting Kim before she married.

6.heading: Kim.
6.title: "Kim's Summer Daydream"
6.author: by Garry Trudeau.
notes: Summary: Kim borrows Mike's daydream to promote social justice, and convinces Michael Jordan to give back Nike's money.

7.heading: Kim.
7.title: "Sending a Powerful Message"
7.author: G
notes: Summary: Kim talks with Lisa Leslie of the L.A. Sparks (WNBA), about returning Nike's money.
Key words: Endorsement contracts, women's basketball.

8.heading: Kim.
8.title: "Your Beeper or Mine?"
8.author: G
notes: Summary: Michael Jordan thanks Kim for reminding him that in his position he can make a difference; Tiger Woods calls.
Key words: Phone calls, endorsement contracts.
